results.title: The Week’s Most Interesting Trailers: ‘Dark Phoenix’ and ‘Hobbs & Shaw’
results.abstract: A blond Jessica Chastain and extensive action scenes liven up those clips, and we finally get to hear Mark Hamill as Chucky in the promo for “Child’s Play.”

results.title: John Cho on Heritage, Hashtags and Hollywood’s Surprises
results.abstract: He talks about taking the lead — this spring, in a documentary and “The Twilight Zone” — and whether “Harold & Kumar” has smoked its last joint.

results.title: How ‘The Curse of La Llorona’ Creates Chills
results.abstract: The director Michael Chaves narrates a scene from this thriller about a menacing mother.

results.title: For 15 Hours, He’s in Charge of Wagner’s ‘Ring’
results.abstract: The conductor Philippe Jordan, 44, is relatively little known in the United States, but he’s at the crossroads of a major career in Europe.

results.title: His Children Called Him the Duke of Villanova. But Who Really Was He?
results.abstract: Janny Scott’s memoir, “The Beneficiary: Fortune, Misfortune, and the Story of My Father,” explores the consequences of generations of inherited Main Line wealth.
